intro: Pedicularis hintonii, commonly known as the Hinton's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pink or reddish and are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Pedicularis hintonii is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and its ability to form symbiotic relationships with mycorrhizal fungi.
